treatment.description: Plants 10–100(–150) cm (weakly self-incompatible); branching excurrent, distal stems usually sparsely to densely stipitate-glandular, rarely eglandular. Leaves: blades green or gray-green, distal stipitate-glandular, glands yellow or golden. Heads in paniculiform arrays. Calyculi of 3–5 bractlets. Involucres obconic. Phyllaries 5–7 mm, hirtellous to piloso-hirsute on angles, hairs ± patent to antrorsely curved, 0.3–1+ mm. Ray laminae 7–13 mm. Cypselae glossy. 2n = 14.
treatment.discussion: Lagophylla glandulosa comprises spring and summer–fall flowering populations that occur widely in the northern Great Valley and surrounding foothills of the North Inner Coast Ranges, Cascade Range, and Sierra Nevada.
